en.Slide 2: The number of comparisons made by the inner for loop on the $i^{th}$ iteration is always $n-i$
en.Slide 3: Consider the following example of an array with 6 elements
en.Slide 21: The total amount of comparisons will be the surface area of this shape
en.Slide 22: The total area will be the sum of the areas of the big traingle and the series of (n-1) small traingles
en.Slide 23: So, the total area is $\frac{(n-1)(n-1)}{2} + \frac{(n-1)}{2}$ which gives $\frac{n(n-1)}{2}$
en.Slide 24: And therefore, the worst case running time of Bubble sort is $\theta(n^2)$
